channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Chloe Kim's protégé foiled her Olympic three-peat dreams. She's celebrating anyway
item.description: Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.
item.content:encoded:
Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.

(Image credit: Cameron Spencer)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Gothic lust, chair lust and big-league dreams are in theaters this weekend
item.description: A fever-dream of a "Wuthering Heights" adaptation is out this weekend starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. And Stephen Curry-produced GOAT is a speedy, snazzily animated sports flick.
item.content:encoded: A fever-dream of a "Wuthering Heights" adaptation is out this weekend starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. And Stephen Curry-produced GOAT is a speedy, snazzily animated sports flick.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: The 800th 'The Simpsons' episode is set in Philadelphia. But Portland is in its DNA
item.description: As The Simpsons celebrates a landmark episode, a tour of creator Matt Groening's hometown reveals the real-world Portland landmarks behind characters like Ned Flanders and Sideshow Bob.
item.content:encoded:
As The Simpsons celebrates a landmark episode, a tour of creator Matt Groening's hometown reveals the real-world Portland landmarks behind characters like Ned Flanders and Sideshow Bob.

(Image credit: The Simpsons)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: How to hone your 'friendship intuition'
item.description: Friendship expert Kat Vellos shares tips on how to make a new friendship stick, including what to do together, how often to hang out — and what to do if the vibes just aren't there.
item.content:encoded: Friendship expert Kat Vellos shares tips on how to make a new friendship stick, including what to do together, how often to hang out — and what to do if the vibes just aren't there.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: 'Dawson's Creek' star James Van Der Beek has died at 48
item.description: Van Der Beek played Dawson Leery on the hit show Dawson's Creek. He announced his colon cancer diagnosis in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
Van Der Beek played Dawson Leery on the hit show Dawson's Creek. He announced his colon cancer diagnosis in 2024.

(Image credit: Valerie Macon)
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: February may be short on days -- but it boasts a long list of new books
item.description: The shortest month of the year is packed with highly anticipated new releases, including books from Michael Pollan, Tayari Jones and the late Nobel laureate Mario Vargas Llosa.
item.content:encoded: The shortest month of the year is packed with highly anticipated new releases, including books from Michael Pollan, Tayari Jones and the late Nobel laureate Mario Vargas Llosa.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: Auditions for 'Handmaid's Tale' opera draw more than 1,000 hopefuls
item.description: More than a thousand people signed up for auditions in hopes of becoming an extra in the upcoming opera of "The Handmaid's Tale" in Detroit.
item.content:encoded: More than a thousand people signed up for auditions in hopes of becoming an extra in the upcoming opera of "The Handmaid's Tale" in Detroit.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Life, liberty and the very American pursuit of humor
item.description: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.content:encoded: The Declaration of Independence states that all men have certain "unalienable rights." From Mark Twain to Jon Stewart, satirists have picked apart that guarantee and what politicians do to honor it.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.content:encoded: A group of Latino high school students in Chicago didn't feel represented by a local museum. They successfully petitioned the museum, resulting in a new exhibit reflecting local Latino history.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Pupovac
